data.title: Government Institutions
data.meta_description: Country Assignment - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. The document provides a history of Tuvalu, including its colonial history under British rule from 1877 and becoming independent in 1978. It then discusses the culture of Tuvalu, including traditional dancing, music, dress, and importance of Christianity. It also summarizes the cuisine of Tuvalu, which is based on staples like pulaka (swamp taro), coconut, fish, and bananas. American occupation during WWII introduced canned foods and more sugar to the diet, which later led to health issues. The governance system establishes Tuvalu as a parliamentary democracy and constitutional monarchy.
